sdp_rule.name: OS Certified?
sdp_rule.sdp_command: import $OS_NAM,$OS_TYP,$OS_ARC var $BOOK = "Oracle Database Installation Guide 11g Release 1 (11.1) for Linux" call setHcveVariable('$BOOK') if match($OS_ARC,'(Power|pSeries)',true) return setHcveResult('Not certified [Platform]') if match($OS_ARC,'Itanium',true) {call setHcveResult(check($OS_TYP,\ 'Oracle',check(lc($OS_NAM),\ '(carthage|^oracle.*release\s5\.\d+$)', cmp_kernel('Oracle 5','2.6.18'),\ 'october', cmp_kernel('Oracle 4','2.6.9'),\ 'Not certified [Oracle version on Itanium]'),\ 'Red Hat',check(lc($OS_NAM),\ 'tikanga', cmp_kernel('RH EL5','2.6.18'),\ 'nahant', cmp_kernel('RH EL4','2.6.9'),\ 'Not certified [Red Hat version on Itanium]'),\ 'SuSE',check(uc($OS_NAM),\ 'SLES-10', cmp_kernel('SuSE 10','2.6.16.21'),\ 'Not certified [SuSE version on Itanium]'),\ 'Check certification')) } else {call setHcveResult(check($OS_TYP,\ 'Asianux',check(lc($OS_NAM),\ 'quartet', cmp_kernel('Asianux 3.0','2.6.18'),\ 'trinity', cmp_kernel('Asianux 2.0','2.6.9'),\ 'Not certified [Asianux version]'),\ 'Oracle',check(lc($OS_NAM),\ '(carthage|^oracle.*release\s5\.\d+$)', cmp_kernel('Oracle 5','2.6.18'),\ 'october', cmp_kernel('Oracle 4','2.6.9'),\ 'Not certified [Oracle version]'),\ 'Red Hat',check(lc($OS_NAM),\ 'tikanga', cmp_kernel('RH EL5','2.6.18'),\ 'nahant', cmp_kernel('RH EL4','2.6.9'),\ 'Not certified [Red Hat version]'),\ 'SuSE',check(uc($OS_NAM),\ 'SLES-10', cmp_kernel('SuSE 10','2.6.16.21'),\ 'SLES-11', cmp_kernel('SuSE 11','2.6.27.19-5'),\ 'Not certified [SuSE version]'),\ 'Check certification')) }
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks for the correct version of Linux for installing Oracle Database 11g.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The correct version of Linux is installed on your server.

!!SHOWSTOPPER!! |Not certified ...|You do not have the correct version of Linux installed on your server or your server is running on an unacceptable platform. For the certified versions of Linux, see the ${'BOOK} and Certifications and Knowledge Article 169706.1 on My Oracle Support.| |Check certification|For less common operating systems, it is possible that they may be certified and not verified by this rule. Please verify that your operating system is certified. For the certified versions of Linux, refer to the ${'BOOK} and Certifications and Knowledge Article 169706.1 in My Oracle Support.|

sdp_rule.name: User in /etc/passwd?
sdp_rule.sdp_command: call setHcveResult(cond(\ not(testFile('r','/etc/passwd')),\ 'Can not read /etc/passwd',\ grepFile('/etc/passwd',\ concat('^',$usr = first(command('/usr/bin/id -nu')),':'),\ 'f'),\ 'userOK',\ concat($usr,' not in /etc/passwd.')))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule verifies that the user name of the user who runs this script is in the ``/etc/passwd`` file.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The ``/etc/passwd`` file contains the user. No action is required.

The ``/etc/passwd`` file does not contain the user or the file has no read permissions. Add the user to the ``/etc/passwd`` file if the user does not exist in the file. NIS-managed users are not recommended.

sdp_rule.name: Group in /etc/group?
sdp_rule.sdp_command: call setHcveResult(cond(\ not(testFile('r','/etc/group')),\ 'Can not read /etc/group',\ grepFile('/etc/group',concat('^',command('/usr/bin/id -ng'),':'),'f'),\ 'GroupOK',\ 'Group not in /etc/group'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule verifies that the group to which the user belongs exists in the ``/etc/group`` file.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The ``/etc/group`` file contains the group of the user. No action required.
ALERT: The ``/etc/group`` file does not contain the group. Add the group to the ``/etc/group`` file.

sdp_rule.name: Enter ORACLE_HOME
sdp_rule.sdp_command: Planned ORACLE_HOME location
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule prompts the user for the planned Oracle home directory.

sdp_rule.name: ORACLE_HOME Valid?
sdp_rule.sdp_command: import $ORACLE_HOME call setHcveResult(cond(\ not(defined($ORACLE_HOME)), 'OHNotSpecified',\ not(testDir('d',$ORACLE_HOME)),'OHnotvalid',\ not(testDir('l',$ORACLE_HOME)),'OHexists',\ 'OHsymlink'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks for the Oracle home directory.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The Oracle home directory exists. No action required
The Oracle home directory must be specified for its validity to be checked.

ALERT: There is something wrong with the Oracle home directory. Verify the following: |*Return Value*|*Action*| |OHnotvalid|Ensure that you provided the correct location or that this directory is created and then run this script again| |OHsymlink|ORACLE_HOME is a symbolic link|

sdp_rule.name: O_H Permissions OK?
sdp_rule.sdp_command: import $ORACLE_HOME call setHcveResult(cond(\ not(defined($ORACLE_HOME)), 'OHNotSpecified',\ not(testDir('d',$ORACLE_HOME)),'OHNotExist',\ not(testDir('r',$ORACLE_HOME)),'NoReadPerm',\ not(testDir('w',$ORACLE_HOME)),'NoWritePerm',\ not(testDir('x',$ORACLE_HOME)),'NoExecutePerm',\ 'CorrectPerms'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks that the user has the correct privileges to install Oracle Database 11g in the Oracle home directory.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The permissions for the Oracle home directory are correct. No action required.
The Oracle home directory must be specified for its permissions to be checked.

|*Return Value*|*Action*| |NoReadPerm|Ensure that the install user has read permissions for the Oracle home directory| |NoWritePerm|Ensure that the install user has write permissions for the Oracle home directory| |NoExecutePerm|Ensure that the install user has execute permissions for the Oracle home directory| |OHNotExist|The Oracle home directory does not exist. Create the Oracle home mount point, and ensure that the permissions are set correctly (``chmod 755``)| |OHNotSpecified|Specify ORACLE_HOME so that RDA can verify the Oracle home directory|

sdp_rule.name: oraInventory Permissions
sdp_rule.sdp_command: call setHcveResult(cond(\ not(testFile('f','/etc/oraInst.loc')),\ 'oraInventoryNotFound',\ not(testFile('wr',$INV_LOC = \ value(grepFile('/etc/oraInst.loc','^inventory_loc','f')))),\ 'oraInventoryNotOK',\ 'oraInventoryOK')) call setHcveVariable('$INV_LOC')
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule verifies that the user installing Oracle Database 11g has sufficient privileges for the ``oraInventory`` directory.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: Either the user, who is logged in, has sufficient privileges for the ``oraInventory`` directory to install Oracle Database 11g or this is the first Oracle product to be installed on the system. In that case, the installer creates the ``oraInventory`` directory. No action required.

The user, who is logged in, cannot access (write and read) the ``oraInventory`` directory while installing Oracle Database 11g. Verify that the user can write to the directory specified in the ``/etc/oraInst.loc`` file. |*Return Value*|*Action*| |oraInventoryNotOK|Make sure that the install user has write permissions to ${`INV_LOC}| |oraInventoryNotFound|The ``/etc/oraInst.loc`` file was not found.%BR%This is not a problem if this is the first Oracle installation on the system.|

sdp_rule.name: Got Software Tools?
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule verifies that the required assembly tools for the installation of Oracle Database 11g exist.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: All required assembly tools for the installation of Oracle Database 11g were found. No action required.

Some of the required assembly tools for the Oracle Database 11g installation were not found. Check your installation. |*Return Value*|*Action*| |ArNotFound|``ar`` is not found in ``PATH``.| |ArElsewhere|``ar`` is not in ``/usr/bin`` as required.| |LdNotFound|``ld`` is not found in ``PATH``.| |LdElsewhere|``ld`` is not in ``/usr/bin`` as required.| |NmNotFound|``nm`` is not found in ``PATH``.| |NmElsewhere|``nm`` is not in ``/usr/bin`` as required.| |MakeNotFound|``make`` is not found in ``PATH``.| |MakeElsewhere|``make`` is not in ``/usr/bin`` as required.|

sdp_rule.name: Umask Set to 022?
sdp_rule.sdp_command: import $BOOK call setHcveResult(cond(expr('==','022',command('"umask"')),\ 'UmaskOK',\ 'UmaskNotOK')) # Force shell
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks that the ``umask`` value is set correctly for installing Oracle Database 10g.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The ``umask`` value is set correctly for installing Oracle Database 10g. No action required.
The ``umask`` value is not set correctly. Set the ``umask`` to 022 before installing Oracle Database 10g. For more information, see the ${'BOOK}.

sdp_rule.name: Limit Processes?
sdp_rule.sdp_command: var $shl = getEnv('SHELL') macro proc_lmt {var ($cmd,$flg) = @arg var ($val) = command($cmd) if $flg var $val = field('\s+',1,$val) if compare('eq',$val,'unlimited') return 'Adequate' return cond(and(isNumber($val),expr('>=',$val,16384)),\ 'Adequate',\ 'Less than 16384') } macro proc_lmt_ksh {var ($cmd) = @arg var $val = field('\s',-1,\ grepCommand($cmd,'^(max user processes|processes|nproc)','if')) if compare('eq',$val,'unlimited') return 'Adequate' return cond(and(isNumber($val),expr('>=',$val,16384)),\ 'Adequate',\ 'Less than 16384') } call setHcveResult(check(\ $shl,'csh',proc_lmt(concat($shl,' -f -c "limit -h maxproc"'),true),\ 'ksh',proc_lmt_ksh(concat($shl,' -c "ulimit -Ha"')),\ proc_lmt(concat($shl,' -c "ulimit -Hu"'),false)))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks that the hard limit of maximum processes is set to 16384 or higher.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The hard limit of maximum processes is set to 16384 or higher.
|*Return Value*|*Action*| |Less than 16384|Set the hard limit for maximum processes to 16384 or higher. For information about configuring this parameter, refer to the ${'BOOK}.|

sdp_rule.name: Limit Descriptors
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks that the hard limit of open file descriptors is set to 65536 or higher.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The hard limit of descriptors is set to 65536 or higher.
|*Return Value*|*Action*| |Less than 65536|Set the hard limit for open file descriptors to 65536 or higher. For information about configuring this parameter, refer to the ${'BOOK}.|

sdp_rule.name: LDLIBRARYPATH Unset?
sdp_rule.sdp_command: call setHcveResult(cond(\ defined(getEnv('LD_LIBRARY_PATH')),'IsSet','UnSet'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks that the ``LD_LIBRARY_PATH`` environment variable is not set.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The ``LD_LIBRARY_PATH`` environment variable is not set. No action required.
The ``LD_LIBRARY_PATH`` environment variable is set in your environment and must be unset before installing Oracle Database 11g.

sdp_rule.name: JAVA_HOME Unset?
sdp_rule.sdp_command: call setHcveResult(cond(\ defined(getEnv('JAVA_HOME')),'IsSet','UnSet'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks that the JAVA_HOME environment variable is not set.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The JAVA_HOME environment variable is not set. No action required.
The JAVA_HOME environment variable is set in your environment and must be unset before installing Oracle Database 11g.

sdp_rule.name: Enter JDK Home
sdp_rule.sdp_command: JDK Home
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule prompts the user for the JDK home.

sdp_rule.name: JDK Version
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks that the installed JDK version is JDK 1.5 or later. This is required for products like Oracle Java Database Connectivity and Oracle Call Interface drivers.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The correct JDK version is installed.

|*Return Value*|*Action*| |Need 1.5 or later|Install JDK ${MINJDK} or later| |JDK bin directory is missing|Install full JDK package.| |JDK compiler is missing|Install full JDK package.| |... not verified|Cannot verify the version. Make sure JDK ${MINJDK} or later is installed.| |JDK home is missing|Provide correct location for JDK home.|

sdp_rule.name: Other O_Hs in PATH?
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks to ensure that the PATH variable does not contain any references to other Oracle home directories based on the /etc/oratab entries.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The PATH does not contain any of the Oracle home directories in the ``/etc/oratab`` file. No action required.
The PATH variable contains one or more references to the Oracle home directories in the ``/etc/oratab`` file. Remove these references for the PATH variable before installing Oracle Database 11g.

sdp_rule.name: Other OUI Up?
sdp_rule.sdp_command: call setHcveResult(cond(\ grepCommand('/bin/ps -ef','runInstaller','i'),'AnotherOUIup','NoOtherOUI'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks for another active ``runInstaller`` process on the system.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: No other ``runInstaller`` process is running. No action required.
Stop the other instance of ``runInstaller`` that is active on your system.

sdp_rule.name: Temp Adequate?
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks that there is sufficient space available for storing temporary files during the Oracle Database 10g installation.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: There is sufficient temporary disk space available for installing Oracle Database 10g. No action required.

The temporary space is not configured correctly. |*Return Value*|*Action*| |/tmp lessThan150|ALERT - ``/tmp`` has less than the required 150 MB of available disk space that it must have. Take appropriate action.| |/tmp invalidDir|ALERT - ``/tmp`` is not a valid directory. ``/tmp`` needs to be a directory.| |/tmp NoWrite|ALERT - The user does not have write permissions to the ``/tmp`` directory.| |/tmp tooSmall|ALERT - There is less than the needed 400 MB of free space in the ``/tmp`` directory.| |TEMP invalidDir|ALERT - ``TEMP`` is set to ${`RULE.A00230.TEMP} in the environment; however, ${`RULE.A00230.TEMP} is an invalid directory. Take appropriate action.| |TEMP NoWrite|ALERT - ``TEMP`` is set to ${`RULE.A00230.TEMP} in the environment; however, the user does not have write permissions to ${`RULE.A00230.TEMP}.| |TEMP tooSmall|ALERT - ``TEMP`` is set to ${`RULE.A00230.TEMP} in the environment; however, ${`RULE.A00230.TEMP} has less than the required 400 MB of free space. Make sure your temporary space has at least 400 MB of free space.| |TMP invalidDir|ALERT - ``TMP`` is set to ${`RULE.A00230.TMP} in the environment; however, ${`RULE.A00230.TMP} is an invalid directory. Take appropriate action.| |TMP NoWrite|ALERT - ``TMP`` is set to ${`RULE.A00230.TMP} in the environment; however, the user does not have write permissions to ${`RULE.A00230.TMP}.| |TMP tooSmall|ALERT - ``TMP`` is set to ${`RULE.A00230.TMP} in the environment; however, ${`RULE.A00230.TMP} has less than the required 400 MB of free space. Make sure your temporary space has at least 400 MB of free space.| |TMPDIR invalidDir|ALERT - ``TMPDIR`` is set to ${`RULE.A00230.TMPDIR} in the environment; however, ${`RULE.A00230.TMPDIR} is an invalid directory. Take appropriate action.| |TMPDIR NoWrite|ALERT - ``TMPDIR`` is set to ${`RULE.A00230.TMPDIR} in the environment; however, the user does not have write permissions to ${`RULE.A00230.TMPDIR}.| |TMPDIR tooSmall|ALERT - ``TMPDIR`` is set to ${`RULE.A00230.TMPDIR} in the environment; however, ${`RULE.A00230.TMPDIR} has less than the required 400 MB of free space. Make sure your temporary space has at least 400 MB of free space.| |TMPDIR lessThan200|ALERT - ${`TMPDIR} has less than the required 200 MB of free space. Make sure your ${`TMPDIR} has at least 200 MB of free space.| Note: The ``runInstaller`` (OUI) uses or checks for temporary space by checking for the ``TEMP`` environment variable first, then the ``TMP`` environment variable, and finally the ``/tmp`` mount point. %BR%The operating system also requires additional space by creating files under ``/tmp`` or using the ``TMPDIR`` environment variable if it finds it.

sdp_rule.name: Disk Space?
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule verifies that the amount of disk space in the Oracle home directory is sufficient for installing Oracle Database 11g.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The Oracle home directory has sufficient disk space to install Oracle Database software and create a database. No action required.
The Oracle home directory must be specified for its permissions to be checked.

The Oracle home directory has insufficient disk space for installing any type of Oracle Database 11g architecture. Verify the specifications in the ${'BOOK}. |*Return Value*|*Action*| |OnlySpaceForOne|${`ORACLE_HOME} has sufficient free disk space to install the Oracle Database 11g software but not enough to create a database.| |NoSpace|${`ORACLE_HOME} has insufficient free disk space for an Oracle Database 11g installation.| |OHNotValid|Disk space calculations cannot be performed since ${`ORACLE_HOME} is not a valid directory|

sdp_rule.name: Swap (in MB)
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule shows the amount of free swap space.

sdp_rule.name: Adequate RAM (in MB)?
sdp_rule.sdp_command: call setHcveResult(nvl(\ field('\s+',1,grepCommand('/usr/bin/free -m','Mem','f')),\ 0))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule verifies that your system has sufficient physical memory installed to install Oracle Database 11g.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: You have sufficient physical memory installed to install Oracle Database 11g. No action required.
ALERT: You do not have sufficient physical memory in your system to install Oracle Database 11g.

sdp_rule.name: Swap OK?

sdp_dependencies.sdp_dependency: Requires amount of RAM and that it be adequate.

sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule verifies that the total amount of swap space is greater than or equal to the amount recommended.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The amount of swap space meets the minimum requirements for installing Oracle Database 11g. No action required.

The amount of swap space is less than the amount recommended by the ${'BOOK} or vital conditions were not satisfied. Verify the requirements and adjust your system accordingly. |*Return Value*|*Action*| |MemNotDetermined|ALERT - A Swap to Memory ratio cannot be determined because the amount of memory was not determined.| |SwapNotDetermined|ALERT- A Swap to Memory ratio cannot be determined because swap is not set up or you do not have execute permissions to determine swap.| |MemInsufficient|ALERT - A Swap to Memory ratio was not determined because the amount of memory was less than the minimum requirements.| |SwapLessThanRAM|Alert - Review ${'BOOK} and Knowledge Article 169706.1 for the correct ratio of Swap to RAM.|

sdp_rule.name: Network
sdp_rule.sdp_command: import $BOOK call setHcveResult(cond(\ not(testFile('x','/sbin/ifconfig')), 'Cannot access /sbin/ifconfig',\ grepCommand('/sbin/ifconfig','eth','f'), 'Connected',\ 'Not connected. Check log.'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks that the system is connected to a network. You can install Oracle Database 11g on a standalone system that is not connected to a network or on a system that is connected to a network. Although both cases are supported, when the system is not connected to a network, you must configure the system to resolve the host name of the system to either a static IP address or a loopback IP address. To access Oracle Database 11g, you must use a local browser. For more information, see the ''Oracle Database Installation Guide 11g Release 1 (11.1) for Linux''.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The system is connected to a network.
|*Return Value*|*Action*| |Cannot access /sbin/ifconfig|Grant execute permissions on ``/sbin/ifconfig`` to the user who is logged in.|

sdp_rule.name: IP Address
sdp_rule.sdp_command: var $hst = field('\.',0,command('hostname')) var ($lin) = grepFile('/etc/hosts',\ concat('^[^#]+\s\<?',quote($hst),'\>?($|\.|\s)'),'f') call setHcveResult(field('\s+',0,$lin))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule gets the host IP address.

sdp_rule.name: Domain Name
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule gets the host domain name.

sdp_rule.name: DNS Lookup
sdp_rule.sdp_command: var $dom = "%A00300%" var $ip = "%A00290%" var $hst = field('\.',0,command('hostname')) if !length($hst) {if and(compare('ne',$dom,'Not configured'),length($dom)) var $hst = concat($hst,'.',$dom) } call setHcveResult(cond(\ not(length($ip)),\ 'Cannot determine IP address',\ not(testFile('x','/usr/bin/nslookup')),\ 'Cannot access /usr/bin/nslookup',\ not(grepCommand(concat('/usr/bin/nslookup -sil ',$hst),quote($ip),'f')),\ 'nslookup host.domain',\ not(grepCommand(concat('/usr/bin/nslookup -sil ',$ip),quote($hst),'f')),\ 'nslookup IP_address',\ 'Host correctly registered in DNS'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks that the host is registered correctly in the DNS.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The host is registered correctly in the DNS.

|*Return Value*|*Action*| |nslookup host.domain|The DNS server failed to resolve the nslookup using host.domain.| |nslookup IP_address|The DNS server failed to resolve the nslookup using IP address.| |Cannot determine IP address|Fix any problem with the host IP address.| |Cannot access /usr/bin/nslookup|Grant execute permissions on ``/usr/bin/nslookup`` to the user who is logged in.|

sdp_rule.name: /etc/hosts Format
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks that the ``/etc/hosts`` file contains a line with ``ip_address fully_qualified_domainname short_hostname``.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The ``/etc/hosts`` entry for the fully qualified domain name and host name is adequate.
Grant read permissions on ``/etc/hosts`` to the current user.

The fully qualified host name and host name are not configured correctly. Ensure that there is an IP address entry for the fully qualified domain name with the host name as one of the aliases. |*Return Value*|*Action"| |no entry found|No entry with the fully qualified domain name followed by the host name was found.| |no correct entry found|No entry beginning with an IP address with the fully qualified domain name followed by the host name was found.|

sdp_rule.name: Kernel Parameters OK?

sdp_dependencies.sdp_dependency: Requires the amount of available physical memory.

sdp_rule.sdp_command: import $OS_BIT,$BOOK var @tbl = () var $AIONRMAX = 1048576 var $FILEMAXREQD = 6815744 var $RMEMDFTREQD = 262144 var $RMEMREQD = 4194304 var $SEMMNIREQD = 128 var $SEMMNSREQD = 32000 var $SEMMSLREQD = 250 var $SEMOPMREQD = 100 var $SHMALLREQD = 2097152 var $SHMMAXREQD = expr('*',%A00260%,524288) var $SHMMAXREQD = max(2147483648,$SHMMAXREQD) var $SHMMAXREQD = min(4294967295,$SHMMAXREQD) var $SHMMNIREQD = 4096 var $WMEMREQD = 262144 var $WMEMMAXREQD = 1048576 call setHcveVariable('$AIONRMAX','$FILEMAXREQD','$RMEMDFTREQD','$RMEMREQD',\ '$SEMMNIREQD','$SEMMNSREQD','$SEMMSLREQD','$SEMOPMREQD',\ '$SHMALLREQD','$SHMMAXREQD','$SHMMNIREQD','$WMEMREQD',\ '$WMEMMAXREQD') macro chk_minimum {var (\@tbl,$nam,$max,$val) = @arg if !defined($val) {call push(@tbl,concat($nam,'Undef')) return } if expr('<',$val,$max) call push(@tbl,concat($nam,'TooSmall')) } if grepCommand('/sbin/sysctl -e aio-max-nr','=\s*(\d+)','f1') {if expr('>',last,$AIONRMAX) call push(@tbl,'AIO-MAX-NRTooLarge') } else call push(@tbl,'AIO-MAX-NRUndef') call chk_minimum(\@tbl,'FILEMAX',$FILEMAXREQD,\ grepFile('/proc/sys/fs/file-max','.','f')) call chk_minimum(\@tbl,'RMEM_DEFAULT',$RMEMDFTREQD,\ grepCommand('/sbin/sysctl -e net.core.rmem_default','=\s*(\d+)','f1')) call chk_minimum(\@tbl,'RMEM_MAX',$RMEMREQD,\ grepCommand('/sbin/sysctl -e net.core.rmem_max','=\s*(\d+)','f1')) var ($lin) = grepFile('/proc/sys/kernel/sem','.','f') var ($msl,$mns,$opm,$mni) = split('\s+',$lin,5) call chk_minimum(\@tbl,'SEMMNI',$SEMMNIREQD,$mni) call chk_minimum(\@tbl,'SEMMNS',$SEMMNSREQD,$mns) call chk_minimum(\@tbl,'SEMMSL',$SEMMSLREQD,$msl) call chk_minimum(\@tbl,'SEMOPM',$SEMOPMREQD,$opm) call chk_minimum(\@tbl,'SHMALL',$SHMALLREQD,\ grepFile('/proc/sys/kernel/shmall','.','f')) call chk_minimum(\@tbl,'SHMMAX',$SHMMAXREQD,\ grepFile('/proc/sys/kernel/shmmax','.','f')) call chk_minimum(\@tbl,'SHMMNI',$SHMMNIREQD,\ grepFile('/proc/sys/kernel/shmmni','.','f')) call chk_minimum(\@tbl,'WMEM_DEFAULT',$WMEMREQD,\ grepCommand('/sbin/sysctl -e net.core.wmem_default','=\s*(\d+)','f1')) call chk_minimum(\@tbl,'WMEM_MAX',$WMEMMAXREQD,\ grepCommand('/sbin/sysctl -e net.core.wmem_max','=\s*(\d+)','f1')) call setHcveResult(cond(scalar(@tbl),join("\012",@tbl),'KernelOK'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule verifies that the kernel parameters are set according to recommendations.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The kernel parameters are set according to the ${'BOOK}. No action required.

The kernel parameters are not set according to the ${'BOOK}. See the ${'BOOK}. |*Return Value*|*Action*| |AIO-MAX-NRUndef|AIO-MAX-NR is not defined and must be set to a maximum of ${AIONRMAX}| |AIO-MAX-NRTooLarge|Decrease the kernel paramter AIO-MAX-NR to no more than ${AIONRMAX}| |FILEMAXUndef|FILE-MAX is not defined and must be set to ${FILEMAXREQD}| |FILEMAXTooSmall|Increase the kernel parameter FILE-MAX to at least ${FILEMAXREQD}| |RMEM_DEFAULTTooSmall|Increase the kernel parameter RMEM_DEFAULT to at least ${RMEMDFTREQD}| |RMEM_DEFAULTUndef|RMEM_DEFAULT is not defined and must be set to ${RMEMDFTREQD}| |RMEM_MAXTooSmall|Increase the kernel parameter RMEM_MAX to at least ${RMEMREQD}| |RMEM_MAXUndef|RMEM_MAX is not defined and must be set to ${RMEMREQD}| |SEMMNIUndef|SEMMNI is not defined and must be set to ${SEMMNIREQD}| |SEMMNITooSmall|Increase the kernel parameter SEMMNI to at least ${SEMMNIREQD}| |SEMMSLUndef|SEMMSL is not defined and must be set to ${SEMMSLREQD}| |SEMMSLTooSmall|Increase the kernel parameter SEMMSL to at least ${SEMMSLREQD}| |SEMMNSUndef|SEMMNS is not defined and must be set to ${SEMMNSREQD}| |SEMMNSTooSmall|Increase the kernel parameter SEMMNS to at least ${SEMMNSREQD}| |SEMOPMUndef|SEMOPM is not defined and must be set to ${SEMOPMREQD}| |SEMOPMTooSmall|Increase the kernel parameter SEMOPM to at least ${SEMOPMREQD}| |SHMALLUndef|SHMALL is not defined and must be set to ${SHMALLREQD} or more| |SHMALLTooSmall|Increase the kernel parameter SHMALL to at least ${SHMALLREQD}| |SHMMAXUndef|SHMMAX is not defined and must be set to ${SHMMAXREQD}| |SHMMAXTooSmall|Increase the kernel parameter SHMMAX to ${SHMMAXREQD}. The maximum value is limited to 4GB for 32-bit Linux versions. It is recommended that it not exceed 4GB for 64-bit Linux versions.| |SHMMNIUndef|SHMMNI is not defined and must be set to ${SHMMNIREQD} or more| |SHMMNITooSmall|Increase the kernel parameter SHMMNI to at least ${SHMMNIREQD}| |WMEM_DEFAULTTooSmall|Increase the kernel parameter WMEM_DEFAULT to at least ${WMEMREQD}| |WMEM_DEFAULTUndef|WMEM_DEFAULT is not defined and must be set to ${WMEMREQD}| |WMEM_MAXTooSmall|Increase the kernel parameter WMEM_MAX to at least ${WMEMMAXREQD}| |WMEM_MAXUndef|WMEM_MAX is not defined and must be set to ${WMEMMAXREQD}|

sdp_rule.name: Tainted Kernel?
sdp_rule.sdp_command: if !testFile('x','/sbin/lsmod') return setHcveResult('Cannot run /sbin/lsmod') call loadCommand('/sbin/lsmod') call setHcveResult(cond(\ grepLastFile('not tainted','if'), 'NotTainted',\ grepLastFile('taint','if'), 'Tainted',\ 'NotVerifiable'))
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule determines if the kernel contains tainted modules.

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The Linux kernel is not tainted. No action is required.
The Linux kernel is tainted. For clarification about what action is required, see Knowledge Article 225710.1.

sdp_rule.name: ip_local_port_range OK?
sdp_rule.sdp_description: This rule checks that the ``ip_local_port_range`` kernel parameter is adequate for Oracle Database 11g Release 1 (11.1).

sdp_actions.sdp_action: The sockets defined in ``/proc/sys/net/ipv4/ip_local_port_range`` are adequate for installing Oracle Database 11g. No action required.

The values in ``/proc/sys/net/ipv4/ip_local_port_range`` are not set as recommended for installing Oracle Database 11g. The recommended values are specified in the ${'BOOK} and Knowledge Article 169706.4. Change the values according to latest recommendations: %BR%``$ /bin/echo 9000 65500 > /proc/sys/net/ipv4/ip_local_port_range``
|*Return Value*|*Action*| |LowValue|The recommended low end value for ``ip_local_port_range`` is 9000| |HighValue|The recommended high end value for ``ip_local_port_range`` is 65500| |iplocalNotFound|``ip_local_port_range`` is not present in the ``/proc/sys/net/ipv4`` directory as required|
